COMMENT: pockets of shell fragments small than 1 cm
matrix is mud, shell fragments up to 1.5 cm
burrows present from 77 to 113 cm, burrows filled with shell fragments from above

Thinly interbedded mud (clay and silt) layers are 3 mm to 1 cm thick.  Coarser layers are silty. Some silty layers are discontinuous and form lenses.  Silty layes contain shell fagments while clayeyer layers do not.
Lithic fragments angular to sub angular apparently schistose. Grain size up to very coarse sand
Common shell fragments. Austrofusus at 5 cm above base
